Your POD Point

OLEV Documents

Confirm eligibility for free standard installation

Our standard install for the homecharge POD Point covers the majority of home installs in the UK.

Standard installation terms

Standard Install

Our standard install for the homecharge POD Point covers the majority of home installs in the UK and includes:

  • Install of POD Point on a brick or plaster wall, or suitable permanent structure.
  • The fitting of correct electrical connections and protections.
  • An additional three way consumer unit, if required.
  • Up to 15 metres of cable, run between the distribution board/electricity meter and the POD Point.
  • The cable run will be clipped flush to the wall at a height of no more than 6ft, running above the ground.
  • Up to 15 metres of cable, run between the distribution board/electricity meter and the POD Point.
  • The cable run will be clipped flush to the wall at a height of no more than 6ft, running above the ground.
  • Cable run through a single wal, l no thicker than half a metre.
  • An earth rod in soft ground, if required.

Please note:

  • We assume that your electrical connection is in adequate condition and has sufficient available capacity.

What happens if you need extra works carried out?

  • Photos sent in advance: Work out a customer quote for any additional works.
  • Minor additional works: new quote issued on site, payment taken and work completed on same day (discount offered if quote is accepted on the same day).
  • Significant additional works: engineer site survey on day then project manager will contact within 5 working days with new quote.
  • In all of the above, if you choose not to go ahead you can get a full refund.

Please select any of the below that apply to you to confirm your eligibility for our standard installation package:

The distance between the POD Point and meter or consumer unit is not more than 15 metres.

The cable from the power to the unit will not need to be buried underground.

There is a wall to install the POD Point on next to where I park.

Tell us more about your install (optional)

To increase the likelyhood of your install going ahead on the day, please tell us a little more about your installation.

I live in a listed building.

I live in a block of garage.

I'd like the POD Point in my garage and there is already a consumer unit (fuse box) installed there.

The electricity meter + consumer unit (fuse board) is i n the middle of my house or upstairs.

Select accesories

Key Lock

This lock can be attached to your Pod Point while charging to prevent unauthorised use.

£30.00

Read description

This can be fitted during installation. If you choose to wait and purchase this key lock after your installation, it will cost an additional £100 for the installer to return to fit it.

Portable Cable

This 5m portable cable should be used to connect your EV to the Universal Pod Point.

£150.00

Read description

This portable cable is compatible to use with any electric car. It's 5 meters in length and can be used to plug in your EV on the go in any station.

Fixed Cable Extension

This 7.5m cable can be attached to the Fixed Cable Pod Point for additional length.

£175.00

Read description

The installer can replace this with the original 4.8m cable during installation for no extra fee.

Your details

Payment details

Next

Questions

What else is required once I complete the payment section?

Once you complete the payment page, you will be asked to provide details about your installation. On the last step of the process we will ask you to complete the OLEV application. Your installation will not be scheduled until all necessary documents are received.

How do I know if I'm eligible for the dealership discount?

Do I have to pay full price for the Pod Point if my OLEV application is rejected at a later stage?

If you claim the OLEV grant at this stage of the process and your application is unsuccessful, we will offer you a full refund or the opportunity to pay the remainder of the price.
